page.title: 12A Police Officer
page.content: We interviewed two police officers who are resident beat officers in Darlaston. They've been working in Darlaston for 2 years. They do things like going to court, telling people if their children have been in accidents, handling football riots etc. They go in car chases. They think judges are lenient. They said that crime is mostly commited by children under 17. The crimes that are most common are mugging,vandalism and burglary. They think criminals don't care when they have commited a crime. The police officers said that the worst thing about their job is being on shifts. The worst thing they've had to deal with is an armed robbery where two men escaped in a taxi after they had commited a crime. They have never faced a gun although constable Foster was trained to use one.
